newsitem.title: USA: Olicom A/S to buy CrossComm.
newsitem.headline: Olicom A/S to buy CrossComm.

text.p: Olicom A/S and CrossComm Corp said Friday they had signed an agreement for Olicom to acquire CrossComm.
Each of CrossComm's 9.3 million outstanding shares will be swapped for $5.00 cash, 0.2667 Olicom share and a three-year warrant, they said.
The warrant would equal a right to acquire 0.1075 Olicom share at $19.74 per full share, the companies said.

The acquisition, to be accounted for using purchase accounting, will result in Olicom recognizing a "significant" non-recurring charge in the second quarter in order to write off in-process research and development and certain other acquisition-related expenses, the companies said.

Olicom, based in Denmark, sells a broad range of Token-Ring, Fast Ethernet and asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) local area network products. CrossComm provides ATM and router technology designed for mainframe computer systems.
The companies said they would develop products for both the IBM-centric mainframe and client-server environments.

"Olicom has invested significantly in ATM and Token-Ring switching during the past two years, both independently and through our joint development agreement with Cisco Systems Inc," said Lars Stig Nielsen, Olicom founder and chief executive.
"The acquisition of CrossComm will accelerate our concerted efforts into these high-growth markets by at least 18 months," he said.
